meanings.definition: Lack of moral principles or ethical standards.
meanings.sent1: His unprincipledness was evident in his dishonest actions.
meanings.sent2: The politician's unprincipledness was revealed when he accepted bribes.
meanings.sent3: The unprincipledness of the thief was so blatant that even the police were shocked.
meanings.sent4: Her unprincipledness was like a dark cloud hanging over her reputation.
meanings.sent5: The unprincipledness of the company's CEO left a stain on the entire organization.

meanings.definition: Behavior that is not guided by moral principles.
meanings.sent1: The unprincipledness of his actions caused harm to those around him.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her unprincipledness in the way she treated her employees.
meanings.sent3: The unprincipledness of the cat stealing food from the dog was both amusing and frustrating.
meanings.sent4: The unprincipledness of the storm wreaked havoc on the small town.
meanings.sent5: His unprincipledness in business dealings eventually led to his downfall.
